snippet: Greece’s finance minister, Yanis Varoufakis, and the International Monetary Fund’s chief, Christine Lagarde, met in Washington as the due date neared for a 458 million euro payment to the fund.
abstract: Greek Finance Min Yanis Varoufakis's abrupt decision to meet with International Monetary Fund managing director Christine Lagard adds to investor concerns that Greece may default on its loan; country must pay 458 million euros, about $503 million, to IMF on April 9; Varoufakis says Greece plans to meet all its obligations, but it is unclear how country can secure funds.
lead_paragraph: Greece’s finance minister, Yanis Varoufakis, and the International Monetary Fund’s chief, Christine Lagarde, met in Washington as the due date neared for a 458 million euro payment to the fund.

headline.main: Greece and I.M.F. Hold Talks on Crucial Debt Payment
headline.print_headline: Greece and I.M.F. Hold Talks on a Debt Payment
